raw_response: {"answer_index": 1, "answer_text": "Factitious disorder", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "The patient presents with severe hypoglycemia (glucose 35 mg/dL), a normal HbA1c (5.1%), and decreased C-peptide. Insulinoma would show elevated C-peptide due to endogenous insulin production. Factitious hypoglycemia from exogenous insulin administration leads to low C-peptide (since exogenous insulin suppresses endogenous insulin and C-peptide). The context of psychosocial stress (difficult divorce) and no prior episodes supports a psychiatric etiology. Hypothyroidism and somatization disorder do not cause hypoglycemia. Thus, factitious disorder is most likely."}
